attributes.name: Regionaal Archief Alkmaar
attributes.history: On February 15, 1900 the first Alkmaar municipal archivist, Cornelis Willem Porpoise, was appointed. Thereby laying the foundation for what is now the Alkmaar Regional Archive. One with more than 20 employees, among others manages the archives of individuals, companies, water authorities and 13 municipalities.
attributes.records: In addition to the archives of the 11 participating municipalities, the Alkmaar Regional Archives also manages archives of churches, businesses, associations and families. They contain information through which local and regional activities in religious, economic, political, social and cultural fields can be reconstructed. These archives were obtained from individuals who considered the importance of preservation. The archive contains many different private archives, differing in size.
attributes.holdings: The Alkmaar Regional Archive holds records of past and current civic administrations and associated agencies of Alkmaar, the communities around Alkmaar, and a number of predecessors of the water-board. The regional archive also preserves archives of non- governmental organizations as well as personal records and archives.
attributes.openingTimes: The Alkmaar Regional Archive is open from Tuesday to Friday from 9am to 5pm.
attributes.accessibility: The Alkmaar Regional Archive is within a 5 minute walking distance of the Alkmaar railway station Alkmaar.
attributes.reproductionServices: You can make copies of books, magazines and copied sources (including microfiche) exhibited in the reading room. Requested archives, libraries and material are copied for you by the staff in the reading room.

attributes.name: Protestantse Landelijk Dienstencentrum (Bibliotheek en Archief)
attributes.history: The Protestant National Service Centre is the headquarters of the service organisation of the Protestant Church in the Netherlands. The archive of a church congregation includes many different types of documents. These can be meeting documents, correspondence and annual reports, but also documents about subjects, such as documents about the territory of the church congregation, and about properties and buildings. Baptismal registers, membership registers and marriage books are also part of the church archive.
attributes.openingTimes:
Monday to Thursday 9 a.m. - 9 p.m.
Friday 9 a.m. - 4 p.m.

attributes.name: Oorlogsarchief Rode Kruis - Nederland
parallelFormsOfName: War Archives of the Red Cross - The Netherlands
attributes.history: During World War II, the Red Cross set up the Information Bureau to trace missing Dutch citizens and provide information about them. This concerned Jews, Sinti and Roma, political prisoners, military personnel, internees and prisoners of war in the Dutch East Indies, and Dutch citizens who were forced to work in Germany due to labour deployment. The Red Cross has had the collections under its care for over 70 years and in 2018 chose to transfer them to the National Archives, in the interest of current and future generations.
attributes.openingTimes: Tuesday to Friday: 10.00-17.00
attributes.conditions: If you want to view archive documents, you can reserve them via the website. Taking photographs of archive documents is permitted under certain conditions.

attributes.name: Noord-Hollands Archief
attributes.history:
The Noord-Hollands Archief collects, preserves and makes available the documentary heritage of the province of Noord-Holland, the Kennemerland region (in particular the municipalities of Aalsmeer, Beverwijk, Bloemendaal, Haarlemmerliede en Spaarnwoude, Haarlemmermeer, Heemskerk, Heemstede, Uitgeest, Uithoorn, Velsen and Zandvoort), and of the provincial capital Haarlem.

More information can be found [here](http://www.noord-hollandsarchief.nl/engels/71/)
attributes.buildings: The Noord-Hollands Archief (or North Holland Archives) institution consists of two locations, namely the location at Kleine Houtweg 18 (which contains the State archives in North Holland and the North Holland province archives) and the public center of the archives in the Jan's church at Jansstraat 40 (which contains the municipal and North Holland province archives).
attributes.holdings:
In the Noord-Hollands Archief you can find public records and private archives. The government archives include: the administration of the province of North Holland and provincial services, such as Provincial Public Works and the Provincial Hospital; government institutions and government departments in North Holland, such as the Land Registry, the courts and prisons in North Holland; control of the municipalities Aalsmeer, Beverwijk, Bloemendaal, Haarlem, Haarlem and Spaarnwoude, Haarlemmermeer, Heemskerk, Heemstede, Uitgeest, Uithoorn, Velsen and Zandvoort, municipal services and companies in these municipalities other local government bodies in these municipalities (such as water boards). The private archives include those of churches (including the archives of the Diocese of Haarlem), companies, associations, families and individuals (such as the Haarlem regent family Van Valkenburg) that are or were involved in North Holland. Moreover, it is fairly uncommon that the North Holland Archives also manages some sixty archives of scientific institutions and internationally renowned scientists (such as the personal archives of the physicists Hendrik Lorentz and Pieter Zeeman, who both have won the Nobel Prize).

More information can be found [here](http://www.noord-hollandsarchief.nl/engels/71/)
attributes.openingTimes: Both locations of the Noord-Hollands Archief have a reading room. The reading room at the Jansstraat is opened from Tuesday to Friday from 9am to 5pm and Saturday  from 9am to 2pm (except in July and August). The reading room at the Kleine Houtweg is open from Tuesday to Friday, from 9am to 5pm.
attributes.accessibility:
The archive at the Jansstraat is located in the center of Haarlem, only a five minutes walking distance from the train station. Parking is available at the parking garage at the Damstraat, Stationsplein or the Raaks. Parking is also possible in the Jansstraat, however there is only a very limited amount of parking spaces.

The location at the Kleine Houtweg is located just outside the center of Haarlem, at a walking distance of around 25 minutes from the train station. There is a parking lot reserved for visitors of the North Holland Archives.

attributes.name: NIOD Instituut voor Oorlogs-, Holocaust- en Genocidestudies
parallelFormsOfName: NIOD Institute for War, Holocaust, and Genocide Studies
attributes.history:
Issues related to war violence generate a lot of interest from society and demand independent academic research. NIOD conducts and stimulates such research and its collections are open to all those who are interested.

The Institute was founded on 8 May 1945 to write the history of the Second World War in the Netherlands and in the former Dutch East Indies through independent research. Since 1 January 1999 the Institute is part of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW).

On 9 December 2010 NIOD merged with the Centre for Holocaust and Genocide Studies (CHGS) and it now operates under the name NIOD, Institute for War, Holocaust and Genocide Studies.

NIOD’s area of work covers the 20th and 21st century, with a focus on research into the effects of wars, the Holocaust and other genocides on individuals and society.

More information about the institution itself can be found [here](http://www.niod.knaw.nl/en/about-niod), more about the history of the NIOD can be found [here](http://www.niod.knaw.nl/en/history)
attributes.records:
NIOD collects, makes accessible and preserves archives and collections. 
NIOD regularly receives new archival materials from private persons and organisations and new items for the library are purchased. Through the ‘Don’t throw it away!’ campaign NIOD, together with fifteen Dutch war and resistance museums and war memorial centers, seeks to preserve material from the Second World War owned by individuals and organisations in the Netherlands and the former Dutch East Indies.
More information about this campagin can be found [here](http://www.niod.knaw.nl/en/don%E2%80%99t-throw-it-away).
attributes.holdings:
NIOD manages over 2,500 meters of archival materials. These archives refer to the Second World War in the Netherlands and the Dutch East Indies, including the pre-war years and the aftermath. Among other things, you will find the descriptions of the archives of:
-	The German occupation administration
-	Ministries in The Hague and London
-	Resistance groups
-	Jewish and National Socialist organisations
-	Prison camps in both Europe and Asia.

The library also holds publications on the Second World War in the Netherlands and the Dutch East Indies, as well as books about the Second World War outside the Netherlands, and material about the run-up to and the aftermath of the Second World War. Also, there is a growing collection of books and magazines about extreme war violence and genocides in the 20th and 21st century.

Furthermore, NIOD manages an imagebase containing more than 175,000 images about the Second World War. The images are part of the collections of several Dutch war and resistance museums, war memorial centres and NIOD. Included are a very wide range of images, drawings and posters; from the German invasion in May 1940 to the Canadian liberation of Amsterdam and the Japanese occupation of the Dutch East Indies.
attributes.openingTimes: NIOD’s Reading Room is open on Mondays from 1pm to 5.30pm and Tuesdays to Fridays from 9am to 5.30pm.
attributes.conditions:
NIOD’s archives and collections are accessible for all interested parties. Digitally or in the reading room.

A large part of the archive collection is fully public. However, certain archives have access restrictions due to the privacy protection of people who are still alive. In these cases visitors will be asked to sign an archive declaration or to ask written viewing permission from our director. In the inventories of our archive collections under the heading 'access’ you can see if there are any viewing restrictions for a specific archive.
attributes.accessibility: It is strongly recommend to use public transport to reach the NIOD as parking space is limited and costly. From the Central Station you can take tram 1, 2 or 5 and get off at tram stop Spui. From there it’s a 200-metre walk to the NIOD via the Wijde Heisteeg and the Singel. The NIOD is accessible to people with physical disabilities. Parking facilities in the immediate vicinity of the institute are few and expensive. The parking rate is 5 euro an hour. Parking garages within reasonable distance are: the Stopera, the Bijenkorf, the Europarking, the Museumplein and the De Kolk.
attributes.researchServices:
In the reading room visitors can consult NIOD collections and conduct historical research. 

Visits to the reading room are free of charge and staff members in the reading room are available to answer questions about the collection. 

More information on the reading room can be found [here](http://www.niod.knaw.nl/en/reading-room-library)
attributes.reproductionServices:
Visitors can make their own photo copies or ask a staff member to do it. 

More information on reproduction services can be found [here](http://www.niod.knaw.nl/en/terms-service)

attributes.name: Nieuw Land Erfgoedcentrum

address.contactPerson: Drs. Marloes P.H. van der Sommen

attributes.history: Nieuw Land Erfgoedcentrum (NLE) was a heritage centre in Lelystad. At its core, the NLE was a combination of a museum about Flevoland and an archive that managed documents for various government agencies and private organisations in Flevoland. The NLE was dismantled in the course of 2017. The archive part was split off and transferred to Het Flevolands Archief and the museum part was absorbed into the new heritage park Batavialand.
attributes.openingTimes: Open Tuesday to Thursday: 1 pm - 5 pm

attributes.name: Nederlands Muziek Instituut
attributes.history: The archives of the Nederlands Muziek Insituut are currently being managed by the Haags gemeentearchief (the Hague municipal archives).
attributes.holdings: The collection Nederlands Muziek Instituut currently consists of over 600 archives of Dutch composers, performing musicians and music institutions. It contains more than 75,000 manuscripts mainly of Dutch composers, more than 200,000 letters, thousands of pictures, all kinds of personal documents (diplomas, certificates, diaries, etc.) and audio and video material. Actually this collection is the "memory" of composing and making music Netherlands.
attributes.openingTimes: Tuesday to Friday from 09.00 to 17.00.
attributes.conditions: Please note that access to archive material and viewing microfiches is only possible by appointment.
attributes.accessibility: From The Hague central station it is a ten minute walk and from The Hague Holland Spoor it is a 15 minute walk to the Haags Gemeentearchief It is possible to park in the underground parking garage of the city hall or in the parking garage in de tram tunnel under the Grote Markstraat.

attributes.name: Nederlands Instituut voor Beeld en Geluid
Nationaal archief
attributes.history: The history of the National Archive dates back to 1802. As the national memory institution, the National Archive is custodian not only for the archives of the national government but also the archives of some social organisations and individuals of national importance. Furthermore, the National Archive has a large collection of photographs and historical maps.
attributes.records: The numerous archives originate from three different groups, namely: the central government, the County of Holland (and the regional and provincial administrations in South Holland), and private organisations and individuals.
attributes.holdings:
The Nationaal Archief (Dutch National Archives) is the ‘national memory’ of the Netherlands. Nearly a thousand years of Dutch history is stored at the Nationaal Archief, containing 125 kilometres of archive material. The archive collection consists of printed and handwritten douments, including 300,000 maps and drawings and about 14 million photographs. Moreover, the library holds around 60,000 reference works.

The Nationaal Archief holds many archives relating to World War II, such as archives of the Dutch Ministry of Defence in London while in exile and the archives of the Militair Gezag (military authority) that operated in the Netherlands after the war. There are also many archives relating to post-war ‘cleansing’ (zuivering), such as the cleansing of the civil service but also the courts of special criminal jurisdiction.

More information can be found [here](http://www.gahetna.nl/en/q-and-a/doing-research/topics/world-war-ii)
attributes.openingTimes: The Nationaal Archief's reading room is closed on Monday, Saturday and Sunday. The reading room is open on Tuesday to Friday: 10.00-17.00.
attributes.conditions: The reading room of the Nationaal Archief is accessible for free to all visitors. However, a visitors pass is recquired when entering the reading room. These passes can be requested at the information desk on presentation of a valid passport.
attributes.accessibility: Several building projects take place in the vicinity of the Nationaal Archief. It is currently difficult to reach the Nationaal Archief by car. There are however underground parking garages nearby the Nationaal Archief.

attributes.name: Maror
attributes.openingTimes: The Maror office is open Monday to Thursday from 9 am to 5 pm.

attributes.name: Klooster Sint Agatha - Erfgoedcentrum Nederlands Kloosterleven
attributes.history: The Erfgoedcentrum Nederlands Kloosterleven is located in the front wing of the old monastery and in a newly built archive depot on the monastery grounds. In the centre, over 100 orders and congregations from all over the Netherlands bring together their heritage: archives, publications, historical objects and audiovisual material.
attributes.openingTimes: The reading room is open on Thursday and Friday from 9 am to 5 pm. Please notify in advance of your visit by telephone or email. The staff can then prepare your visit and inform you about special closing dates.
attributes.conditions:
The heritage can be consulted in the reading room and in exhibitions. The catalogues and archive inventories of the centre can be consulted via the website.

In many cases, it is necessary to obtain written permission from the owner of the archive concerned in order to view archive material. An application form for obtaining such written permission can be sent by e-mail or by post.

Archive records relating to living persons are not made available for inspection, unless with the permission of the persons concerned. You can find other rules concerning the reading room in the reading room regulations.

attributes.name: Internationaal Instituut voor Sociale Geschiedenis
attributes.history:
The International Institute of Social History (IISH) was officially established on November 25, 1935, but its history dates back to the 1920s. In 1914, Nicolaas W. Posthumus (1880-1960), who ranked among the pioneers of modern economic history in the Netherlands had set up the Netherlands Economic History Archive (NEHA), the first of a series of scholarly institutions he initiated. The NEHA concentrated on the preservation of archives of companies and related organisations, and on the collection of other sources relevant to economic history. Since Posthumus was a collector with a broad vision, he included materials from individuals and organisations in the Dutch labour movement.

Since 1979 the IISH has been an institute of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW).
attributes.holdings:
Personal archives at the IISH are (among many others) the collections of the papers of Diego Abad de Santillán, Alexander Atabekian, Angelica Balabanoff, Bernt Carlsson, Ruth Fischer, Emma Goldman, Rudolf Hilferding, Karl Kautsky, Gustav Landauer, Arthur Lehning, Max Nettlau, Theodor Liebknecht, Toma Sik and Leon Trotsky.

There are also many institutional archives, among which the archives of the Russian Socialist Revolutionary Party, the Red Army Faction and the International Confederation of Free Trade Unions. Moreover, in the last decades the institute acquired the archives of Greenpeace and Amnesty International.

For more information click [here](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Institute_of_Social_History).
attributes.openingTimes: Opening hours of the Reading Room: Monday to Thursday: 9.00 - 17:00
attributes.conditions:
You can request materials via the catalogue: search.iisg.amsterdam
Please note that permission is required for the use of some archives. This information is listed under the heading 'Access and Use' on the archive description page. You can request permission via the online catalogue. Please arrange permission before making an appointment.
The material can be consulted in the reading room. Visitors do not have access to the stacks.
Pre-requested material is available at 10:00. You can request material during the day. Material is retrieved from the stacks 4 times a day, at: 9:30, 11:00, 13:00 and 15:00.
attributes.accessibility:
Keep in mind that there is only paid parking space near the IISH.

The building is accessible for wheel chairs users.
attributes.researchServices: For questions on collections and for assistance in finding information, you contact the staff at the information desk. At the desk you can also request materials from the depots, deposit or return documents.
attributes.reproductionServices: In general, library and archive material, provided it is in good condition, may be scanned, photographed or copied. For printing or scanning from microfiche, equipment is available. For scanning, copying and printing equipment is available.

attributes.name: Hoogheemraadschap van Schieland en de Krimpenerwaard
attributes.history: The Hoogheemraadschap of the Krimpenerwaard is about a century and a half younger than the Hoogheemraadschap of Schieland. It was established in 1430 after the Sint-Elisabethflood of 1421, when the need for care of the river dykes was recognised.
attributes.conditions: You can consult the archives and collections in the study room. This is only possible by appointment.

attributes.name: Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland
attributes.holdings: The materials of the Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland range from aryan declarations of civil servants, to documents on war damage, and documents on the resignation of Jewish civil servants.
attributes.openingTimes: The Hoogheemraadschap van Delfland is open from Monday to Thursday from 8.30am to 12.30pm and 1.15pm to 4 pm.
attributes.conditions: It is neccessary to make an appointment before visiting the archives.

attributes.name: Historisch Documentatiecentrum voor het Nederlands Protestantisme (1800-heden)
Data Archiving and Networked Services
attributes.records:
DANS is the Dutch national centre of expertise and repository for research data. DANS helps researchers make their data available for reuse. This allows researchers to use the data for new research and makes published research verifiable and reproducible. With more than 200,000 datasets and a staff of 60, DANS is one of the leading repositories in Europe.

The use of FAIR data improves the verifiability and reproducibility of research. It also enhances efficiency because working on datasets is expensive. What is more, linking data can lead to new discoveries and insights. Reusing and connecting data accelerates knowledge circulation and increases our ability to solve complex issues. In short, making better use of data leads to better science, which matters to society.

DANS is an institute of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences (KNAW) and the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO). As part of its mission, DANS supports the open data principle, while being aware of the fact that not all data can be freely available and without limitations at all times. Even so, it is important that research data that is not available (yet) or only available to a limited degree isarchived in a sustained manner. Therefore, DANS applies the principle ‘Open if possible, protected if necessary’.

To ensure that archived data can still be found, accessed and used in the future, DANS took part in the development of the CoreTrustSeal for data repository certification. This data seal can be requested and granted to data repositories that meet a number of clear criteria in the field of quality, preservation and accessibility of data.

DANS gives Training in Research Data Management, for researchers, data professionals, research institutions, research funders and repository managers.
attributes.holdings:
DANS encourages scientific researchers to archive and reuse data in a sustained form via the archiving system EASY. EASY offers access to over 200,000 datasets in the Humanities, e.g. History and Archaeology, Social and behavioural sciences, and Geospatial sciences. Data and documentation files are available for downloading free of charge for registered users.

Moreover, DANS provides access to thousands of scientific datasets and other research information through NARCIS. NARCIS is a national portal focussing on scientific information and descriptions of research projects, experts, and research institutes in the Netherlands. Among others, NARCIS gives access to 2.4 million  publications (of which are 1 million open access), 359,000 datasets, and descriptions of 74,000 research projects. Sources are all Dutch universities, the Academy (KNAW), the national research funder NWO, and other research institutes.
attributes.conditions:
Data and documentation files are available for downloading free of charge for registered users of EASY. In a number of cases, permission from the depositor is required before you can download the datafiles.

Downloading of the information in NARCIS, or copying it in any other fashion, is permitted. One exception applies to this regulation. Re-use of information in the sections "Persons" and "Organizations" is restricted.
attributes.accessibility: A limited amount of parking space is available beneath the Java building. Entrance to the car park is on the Anna van Saksenlaan.

attributes.name: Historisch Centrum Overijssel
attributes.records: The archives of the Historisch Centrum Overijssel stem from government agencies in Overijssel and Zwolle or private collections such as the City of Zwolle, provincial government, courts, notaries, land registry, public works, taxes and civil registry. Or even businesses, agricultural cooperatives, trade unions, foundations, churches, families and societies.
attributes.holdings: The Historisch Centrum Overijssel manages nearly 20 kilometers of archives, 15,000 charters (official documents on parchment), over 15,000 maps, prints, posters and drawings and about 150,000 photographs.
attributes.openingTimes: The Historisch Centrum Overijssel is open from Tuesday to Thursday from 9am to 5pm and on Friday from 9am to 1pm. The reading room is open on Tuesday and Wednesday from 9am to 5pm and on Thursday from 9am to 9pm.
attributes.reproductionServices:
It is possible to make reproductions of photocopied files, or make prints of microfilm and microfiche. The staff at the information deks can make reproductions of original records for you. Not all materials can be reproduced because of its.

Since early 2014, it is possible to create your own digital reproductions, there are several scanners available to convert the materials to a digital file.

attributes.name: Historisch Centrum Leeuwarden
attributes.history: The Historisch Centrum Leeuwarden emerged in 2001 from the former municipal archives of Leeuwarden (the oldest city archive in the Netherlands).
attributes.records: Apart from the governmental materials, the Historisch Centrum Leeuwarden also collects archives of clubs and individuals. Anyone can offer its archive collection or old photographs to the centur for safekeeping.
attributes.holdings: The oldest document in the Historisch Centrum Leeuwarden is from the 13th century. Newer archives include population registers from the 19th and 20th century. In the course of time the archives of municipal institutions such as schools and the police were also managed by the HCL. Later the churches also gave their archives. Furthermore collected archives of companies, families and associations are also managed by the center. The HCL now has 3,000 linear meters of archives over 250 different agencies and individuals.
attributes.openingTimes: The Historisch Centrum Leeuwarden is open from Tuesday to Friday from 11am to 5pm and on Saturday and Sunday from 1 pm to 5pm.
attributes.conditions: On Saturdays and Sundays, the reading room is open on a self-service basis. This means no pieces from the depots can be requested. However, it is possible to request documents by e-mail no later than Thursday morning.
attributes.accessibility:
It is a ten minute walk from the Leeuwarden train station to the Leeuwarden Historisch Centrum.

There are two parking lots close to the archive, a map and more information on accessibility can be found [here](https://historischcentrumleeuwarden.nl/over-ons). The public areas of the HCL are easily accessible to wheelchair and mobility scooter users.

attributes.name: Historisch Centrum Haaksbergen
attributes.history: The Historical Centre Haaksbergen is the information centre on the history of the municipality of Haaksbergen. Archives, books, prints, newspapers, photos, films, videos and sound recordings tell about the history of Haaksbergen.

attributes.name: Herinneringscentrum Kamp Westerbork
attributes.history: Camp Westerbork had the following functions throughout its history: 1939-1942 Central Refugee camp1942-1945 Judendurchgangslager 1945-1948 Interneringskamp voor NSB'ers1949 Military camp 1950-1951 Repatriating camp for "Indische Nederlanders"1951-1971 Woonoord Schattenberg voor Molukkers
attributes.holdings: The Herinneringscentrum Kamp Westerbork mostly has collections on the history of camp Westerbork (1939-1971), the persecutions of Jews in the Netherlands, and the post-war history. The focus is on the period 1939-1945. The collection consists of official documents, ego documents, photos, drawings, items, interviews and books. The ego documents contain letters and cards written in the camp or thrown out of a deportation train, diaries and memoirs written later onwards. The photo collection contains about 8,000 items and documents the daily life in the camp and pictures from daily life or the internees before the war. Most of the drawings are portrets of internees. The official documents vary from transport lists, Lagerbefehlen, announcements, camp cards, work cards, etc., including a full collection of 'De Westerborker' (25 editions, April-June 1945).
attributes.openingTimes: Mon - Fri: 10 am - 5 pm / Sat and Sun: 11 am - 5 pm / Public holidays: 11 a.m. - 5 p.m. / 4th of May: 10 am - 7 p.m.

attributes.name: Haags Gemeentearchief
attributes.history: At the the Haags Gemeentearchief you will find information on the (former) municipalities of The Hague, Loosduinen, Leidschendam, Stompwijk, Veur and Voorburg. The documents in the municipal archive range from documents from the 14th century to very recent materials.
attributes.records: The Haags Gemeentearchief acquires all types of information that both fit into the acquisition profiles and are suitable for a historical reconstruction of the Hague and its residents.
attributes.holdings: The Haags Gemeentearchief's archives range from materials of the Dutch Israelite community, to digitial genealogies, and year reports of the municipality. Moreover, the archives of the Nederlands Muziek Instituut (Dutch Music Institute) are also managed by the Haags Gemeentearchief.
attributes.openingTimes: The Haags Gemeentearchief has two reading rooms. The reading room on the ground floor is open from Monday to Friday from 9am to 4pm. The second reading room is open from Tuesday to Thursday from 9am to 4pm.
attributes.accessibility:
From The Hague central station it is a ten minute walk and from The Hague Holland Spoor it is a 15 minute walk to the Haags Gemeentearchief
It is possible to park in the underground parking garage of the city hall or in the parking garage in de tram tunnel under the Grote Markstraat.

attributes.name: Gemeentelijk Archief Onderbanken
attributes.history:
The archives of the former municipality of Onderbanken can be found in the municipal archives. It concerns the following archives:

Jabeek: population registers 1860-1935, the registers of civil status 1805-1940
Merkelbeek: population registers 1850-1945, the civil status registers 1796-1940
Bingelrade: population registers 1846-1939, civil status registers 1802-1940
Schinveld: population registers 1847-1936 and registers of civil status 1796-1940
Boekwerk gemeente Onderbanken part 1: the former municipality of Jabeek and the former municipality of Bingelrade
Boekwerk gemeente Onderbanken part 2: the former municipality Merkelbeek, the former municipality Schinveld and the current municipality Onderbanken.

attributes.name: Sammlungen der KZ-Gedenkstätte Mauthausen
attributes.history: In the 1960s, work began to collect records and materials on the history of Mauthausen, former Nazi concentration camp. Mauthausen has a relatively large amount of original documentation that managed to survive the war. Such documents have over the years been dispersed among various organizations, archives and people, used as evidence for several war crime trials and for individual research. An effort to consolidate some of this material shall be made by the Mauthausen Memorial.The Mauthausen Memorial archive and library were in the Federal Ministry of Interior in Vienna. Since 2017 the Mauthausen Memorial is separated from the Federal Ministry of the Interior, and it is now a Federal Institution under Public Law
attributes.holdings: The Mauthausen Archive holds camp administration documents, important sources on inmates, post-war trial documentation, photos, videos, and audio recordings relating to the camp's history and the experiences of its inmates. Although some of the archival materials regarding Mauthausen still remain dispersed throughout Europe [see History], the Mauthausen Memorial photo archive and library also contain many relevant records. The library holds 5,000 monographs and articles, which exhibits information on the history of the camp as well as the history of other camps, and information on Nazism in general.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Zuidhorn
attributes.history: The municipalities Grootegast, Leek, Marum and Zuidhorn and the Middag area form the new municipality Westerkwartier.
attributes.conditions: The Zuidhorn municipal archives can be visited by appointment.
attributes.accessibility: The archive inventories can be found on GroningerArchiefnet.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Zoetermeer
attributes.history: The Municipal Archive of Zoetermeer (Stadsarchief) manages the archives of the municipality of Zoetermeer and the former municipality of Zegwaart. The archive inventories are digitally available.
attributes.openingTimes: You can visit the City Archives on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Because the archives are kept in an external depot, you should indicate at least two working days in advance which archive documents you would like to inspect.
attributes.conditions: When you come to visit the Archives, you can register by calling 079-3468577 once you are in the town hall (there is no reception desk). An employee of the Municipal Archives will then pick you up. You require a visitor's pass to visit the City Archive. You can apply for this together with an employee of the City archive at the service desk in the town hall. To apply for a visitor's pass, you must be in possession of a valid identification document.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Weesp
otherFormsOfName: Regionaal Historisch Centrum Vecht en Venen
attributes.history: In the RHC Vecht en Venen and on this site, you will find the archives of the municipalities of Stichtse Vecht, De Bilt, De Ronde Venen and Weesp. More than 600 years of heritage are stored in these depots. The main office and largest reading room is located in the Cultuurhuis in Breukelen. The archives of Stichtse Vecht, De Bilt and De Ronde Venen are housed here. You can also visit changing exhibitions here. In the depot of the municipal office in Weesp, you can consult the archives of Weesp.
attributes.openingTimes: The municipal archives are open on Mondays and Wednesdays from 9.00 to 12.00.
attributes.conditions:
To see the municipal archives you have to make an appointment with the reading room attendant. Doing your own research in the municipal archive is free. You can also request information from the municipal archives by e-mail or by post. If extensive research is required, this will involve costs.

You can also search the collection for a large part on the website of the Regionaal Historisch Centrum: www.rhcvechtenvenen.nl.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Weert
attributes.openingTimes:
The reading room is open by appointment only on weekdays from 9:00 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.
Please send your request at least two working days in advance and before 12.00 noon to gemeentearchief@weert.nl.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Wassenaar
attributes.history: In the municipal archive of Wassenaar, the archives of the municipalities of Wassenaar and Voorschoten are kept. Part of the source material is digitally available through the Digital Study Room.
attributes.openingTimes: The opening hours of the archive are Tuesday to Thursday mornings from 09.30 to 12.30.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Vlagtwedde
attributes.history: The municipal archive of Vlagtwedde contains the records of tasks and activities of the former municipality of Vlagtwedde. In 2018 the new municipality of Westerwolde was formed in which Vlagtwedde and Bellingwedde were incorporated. In the inventory of the archive, also deposited archives are included, among others of the Civil Administration of the municipality of Vlagtwedde 1923-1957 and of the Civil Registrar, 1923-1987.
attributes.openingTimes:
The archive can be visited on: Monday to Friday from 9.00 to 12.00 and from 14.00 to 16.00. Visits by appointment.
To visit the archive, it is advisable to make an appointment with the Department of Facility Services on (0599) 320 220.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Vijfheerenlanden
attributes.history: The municipality of Vianen merged on the 1 January 2018 into the municipality of Vijfheerenlanden.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Venray
attributes.generalContext:
The municipality archive is the historical information center of Venray and surroundings. The work area includes the municipality of Venray and former municipality of Meerlo-Wanssum (dissolved 2010).
The municipality archive manages approximately 1 kilometer of paper archive files, an images collection, an audiovisual collection and a historical library. Consulting these cultural-historical sources in the reading room of the archive is free of charge.
The municipal archives work closely with RooyNet, Venray's heritage portal.
attributes.openingTimes: The reading room is open Tuesday: 09.00-12.30 and 13.00-16.30; Wednesday: on appointment; Thursday: 09.00-12.30 and 13.00-16.30

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Venlo
attributes.holdings: Materials of the Gemeentearchief Venlo range from documents on the confiscation of Jewish possessions to documents on persons who have helped Jews during the occuaption.
attributes.openingTimes: The gemeentearchief Venlo  is open from Tuesday to Friday from 9am to 4.30pm. The reading room is open from Tuesday to Thursday between 09:00 and 12:30.
attributes.accessibility:
It is a 25 to 30 minute walk from the Venlo train station to the gemeentearchief Venlo.

Parking spots in the direct vicinity of the archives are usually free.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Valkenburg aan de Geul
attributes.openingTimes: by appointment only. For urgent enquiries, please contact the Customer Contact Centre on telephone number 14 043.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Tytsjerksteradiel
attributes.openingTimes: To view archive, photos and documentation in the reading room, you can make an appointment with the manager via 14-0511. The archive is open from 9 am to 4.30 pm.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Tholen
attributes.history: The municipal archive of Tholen administers, among other things, the archives of the current municipality and the former municipalities of Oud-Vossemeer, Poortvliet, Scherpenisse, Sint-Annaland, Sint-Maartensdijk, Sint Philipsland, Stavenisse and Tholen.
attributes.openingTimes: Open Monday to Friday by prior reservation.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Skarsterlân
attributes.history: From 2013, the services of the municipalities Gaasterlan-Sleat, Lemsterland and Skarsterlan are carried out by the executive organisation De Friese Meren.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Schouwen-Duiveland
attributes.history: The Schouwen-Duiveland municipal archive has become part of the Zeeuws Archief on 1 January 2021. The archives and collections relating to Schouwen-Duiveland now remain in the depots in Zierikzee.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Schiedam
attributes.holdings: Materials of the Gemeentearchief Schiedam related to the Second World War range from the archive of the former resistance in Schiedam to a collection of illegal and pro-German newspapers, and the archive of the municipal Schiedam police.
attributes.openingTimes: The Gemeentearchief Schiedam is open from Tuesday from Thursday from 9am to 5pm.
attributes.accessibility: For very detailed directions to the Gemeentearchief Schiedam consult the [website](http://www.schiedam.nl/Def/Gemeentearchief/Over-het-archief/Routebeschrijving.html).
attributes.reproductionServices: The details and costs of the reproduction services of the Gemeentearchief Schiedam can be found [here](http://www.schiedam.nl/Def/Gemeentearchief/Over-het-archief/Tarieven-per-1-januari-2015.html).

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Roosendaal
attributes.history:
As of 1 July 2016, the Roosendaal Municipal Archives merged with the Bergen op Zoom archive service and the West Brabant Regional Archives (RAWB) into the West Brabant Archives (WBA) joint arrangement.
The Roosendaal Municipal Archive was the place where the historical information of Roosendaal and the villages of Nispen, Wouw, Wouwse Plantage, Heerle and Moerstraten was kept. The prayer cards, maps and building plans, photos, film material and sound tapes can now be found at the West-Brabants Archive.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Noord-Beveland
attributes.history: The Noord-Beveland municipal archives contain the archives of the municipalities of Colijnsplaat, Kats, Kortgene and Wissenkerke.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Nijefurd
attributes.history: The archive of the municipality consists of the archives of the former municipalities of Bolsward, Littenseradiel, Nijefurd, Sneek, Wûnseradiel and Wymbritseradiel.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Leek
attributes.history: The municipalities of Grootegast, Leek, Marum and Zuidhorn, and the villages of Ezinge, Feerwerd and Garnwerd in the municipality of Winsum have merged to form a new municipality, Westerkwartier, as of 1 January 2019.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Landgraaf
attributes.history: Landgraaf municipal archives contain a large number of documents and image material, both digital and on paper and microfiche. Also present are the archives of the former municipalities of Schaesberg, Nieuwenhagen, Ubach over Worms (until 1982) and Rimburg (until 1887).

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Kollumerland c.a.
attributes.history: The Regional Archive is part of the municipality of Noardeast-Fryslân and works from there for the former municipalities of Dongeradeel, Ferwerderadiel and Kollumerland c.a. and the municipality of Dantumadiel. The Regional Archive manages the archive repositories of all municipalities. Archives older than 20 years are public and accessible to everyone.To visit the archives of the municipality of Dantumadiel and the former municipalities of Ferwerderadiel and Kollumerland c.a., please make an appointment in advance.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Kerkrade
attributes.history: Kerkrade consists of the town of Kerkrade with the same name and the districts of Eygelshoven, Spekholzerheide, Chèvremont and Bleijerheide.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Hillegom
attributes.history:
Since 2009 the municipality of Hillegom has a joint arrangement with the municipality of Leiden concerning archive management.
Visual material of Hillegom can be found at the website of ErfgoedLeiden.
The archives of the municipality of Hillegom from the period 1575-1990 have been transferred to Erfgoed Leiden e.o. These archives are in principle public.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Hengelo
attributes.history:
The Hengelo Municipal Archives takes care of all government and private archives kept in the municipal archive repository (see also archives overview). The archive repository contains approximately one hundred individual archives of both municipal bodies and private entities from various social backgrounds.
The municipal archive is part of the Department of Documentary Information (DIV) and is located in the town hall. Next to the archive depot, a study room has been set up for visitors.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Hardenberg
attributes.history: The Hardenberg Archives is the historical documentation centre for Hardenberg and the surrounding area. For everyone who wants to know something about the history of the municipality of Hardenberg and the former municipalities of Avereest, Gramsbergen, Ambt Hardenberg and Stad Hardenberg.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Groesbeek
attributes.history:
The archives up to 2001 can be viewed at the Regional Archives Nijmegen. It concerns the archives of the former municipalities of Groesbeek, Ubbergen and Millingen aan de Rijn. The Regional Archive is located at Mariënburg 27 in the centre of Nijmegen. All information about opening hours and possibilities can be found on the website of the Regional Archive. 
You can contact the Regional Archive in advance and indicate which archive documents you wish to inspect. The staff member will lay the documents out for you or scan them in. You can contact them at hetarchief@nijmegen.nl or by telephone at +31 (0)24-3292307.
The archive documents from the year 2001 up to the present are kept in the town hall in Groesbeek.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Ede
attributes.history:
The municipal archives of Ede and Scherpenzeel contain documents about the municipality of Ede, surrounding areas and Scherpenzeel. You can search in the archives of schools, associations and companies. Or browse through old newspapers, maps and photos.

You can look up documents digitally, have documents digitised or visit the reading room. Many services of the archive are free, for some activities you have to pay.

attributes.name: Gemeentearchief Borsele te Heinkenszand
attributes.history: The municipality archives manage the old archives of the former municipalities, which were included in the new municipality of Borsele in 1970.
attributes.openingTimes: The archive is open from Monday till Friday from 8.30 till 12.30, Thursdsy also from 14.00 till 17.00.

attributes.name: Gemeente Wymbritseradiel
attributes.history: Wymbritseradiel is a former municipality in the province of Friesland. The municipality merged into the new municipality of Súdwest-Fryslân in 2011. The town hall was located in Witmarsum. The archive of the municipality consists of the archives of the former municipalities of Bolsward, Littenseradiel, Nijefurd, Sneek, Wûnseradiel and Wymbritseradiel.

attributes.name: Gemeente Wûnseradiel
attributes.history: Wûnseradiel is a former municipality in the province of Friesland. The municipality merged into the new municipality of Súdwest-Fryslân in 2011. The town hall was located in Witmarsum. The archive of the municipality consists of the archives of the former municipalities of Bolsward, Littenseradiel, Nijefurd, Sneek, Wûnseradiel and Wymbritseradiel.

attributes.name: Gemeente Westerveld
attributes.history: The municipality of Westerveld was created in 1998 from the municipalities of Diever, Dwingeloo, Havelte and Vledder.

attributes.name: Gemeente Waadhoeke
attributes.history: The municipality of Franekeradeel merged on the 1 January 2018 into the municipality of Waadhoeke.

attributes.name: Gemeente Leeuwarden
attributes.history: The municipality of Littenseradiel was incorporated on the 1 January 2018 into the municipality of Leeuwarden.

attributes.name: Institutul pentru Studii de Holocaust şi Genocid al Universităţii Babeș-Bolyai din Cluj
parallelFormsOfName: Institute for Holocaust and Genocide Studies of Babeș-Bolyai University of Cluj

address.streetAddress: Str. Pandurilor nr. 7 (intrare dinspre Str. Plopilor), Clădirea Juventus, ap. 1
